intro: Gouldia sandwicensis var. terminalis, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame flower, is a striking plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red bracts that surround small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the warm, humid climate of its native habitat. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in tropical regions. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in Hawaiian botany.
